title: Signal File
description: A file containing analyzed sequencing data in signal form using a bigwig or npz format.

content_type.comment: The file format should match the content type of the file. Only sequence attributes should be in npz format.
Content Type describes the content of the file.

enum_descriptions.control signal: A signal coverage track used as a control, representing read coverage from a baseline or reference sample for comparison purposes.
enum_descriptions.fold change over control: A nucleotide-resolution signal coverage track showing the fold change in signal intensity compared to a control at each position.
enum_descriptions.raw signal: The initial signal coverage track representing the unprocessed read counts across the genome before any normalization or statistical adjustments.
enum_descriptions.read-depth signal: A signal coverage track that has been normalized by read depth, providing coverage values adjusted to account for variations in sequencing depth across samples or regions.
enum_descriptions.sequence attributes: A dictionary of signals that represents sequence contribution scores across the genome for a given prediction from deep learning models, for example the npz format signals inferred by DeepLIFT from models trained with ATAC-seq data.
enum_descriptions.signal: A signal coverage track representing the density or intensity of sequencing reads across the genome.
enum_descriptions.signal of all reads: A signal coverage track that includes the combined coverage from all reads, both unique and multimapping, across the genome.
enum_descriptions.signal of unique reads: A signal coverage track that represents the coverage specifically from unique reads, excluding multimapping reads.
enum_descriptions.signal p-value: Nucleotide resolution signal coverage track, expressed as a p-value to reject the null hypothesis that the signal at that location is present in the control.
enum_descriptions.TF binding scores: A signal track represents the transcription factor binding scores across the genome, called from assays such as ATAC-seq data.

strand_specificity.title: Strand Specificity
strand_specificity.description: The strandedness of the signal file: plus, minus, or unstranded.

normalized.title: Normalized
normalized.description: Indicates if the signal file is normalized.

start_view_position.title: Start View Position
start_view_position.description: The 0-based coordinate for the default starting position when viewing the signal in a genome browser.

dbxrefs.comment: This file type currently does not support any external resource submission.

assembly.description: Genome assembly applicable for the annotation data.
